    • Uses of Event4 in com.db4o.events

      Methods in com.db4o.events that return Event4 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.activated()
      This event is fired after an object is activated.
      Event4<CancellableObjectEventArgs> EventRegistry.activating()
      This event is fired before an object is activated.
      Event4<ClassEventArgs> EventRegistry.classRegistered()
      This event is fired when a new class is registered with metadata.
      Event4<ObjectContainerEventArgs> EventRegistry.closing()
      This event is fired when the ObjectContainer.close() is called.
      Event4<CommitEventArgs> EventRegistry.committed()
      This event is fired after a transaction has been committed.
      Event4<CommitEventArgs> EventRegistry.committing()
      This event is fired just before a transaction is committed.
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.created()
      This event is fired after an object is created (saved for the first time).
      Event4<CancellableObjectEventArgs> EventRegistry.creating()
      This event is fired before an object is saved for the first time.
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.deactivated()
      This event is fired after an object is deactivated.
      Event4 EventRegistry.deactivating()
      This event is fired before an object is deactivated.
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.deleted()
      This event is fired after an object is deleted.
      Event4<CancellableObjectEventArgs> EventRegistry.deleting()
      This event is fired before an object is deleted.
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.instantiated()
      This event is fired when a persistent object is instantiated.
      Event4<ObjectContainerEventArgs> EventRegistry.opened()
      This event is fired when the ObjectContainer has finished its startup procedure.
      Event4<QueryEventArgs> EventRegistry.queryFinished()
      This event is fired upon a query end and can be used to gather query statistics.
      Event4<QueryEventArgs> EventRegistry.queryStarted()
      This event is fired upon a query start and can be used to gather query statistics.
      Event4<ObjectInfoEventArgs> EventRegistry.updated()
      This event is fired after an object is updated.
      Event4<CancellableObjectEventArgs> EventRegistry.updating()
      This event is fired before an object is updated.
      Methods in com.db4o.events with parameters of type Event4 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void EventListener4.onEvent​(Event4<T> e, T args)
      The event was triggered.
